info.title: Unified CRM API
info.description:
#### Introduction

Welcome to the Unified API (CRM) documentation. You can use this API to write to multiple third-party providers within the CRM category.

[View common schema for CRM](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/common-schemas/crm)

#### Base API URL
```
https://api.supaglue.io/crm/v2
```

post.description:
Upsert an account. If the account does not exist, it will be created. If the account does exist, it will be updated.
Only supported for Salesforce and Hubspot.

key.description: The key to upsert on. Only `website` is supported for Salesforce, while both `domain` and `website` are supported for Hubspot.

values.description: The values to upsert on. If more than one value is provided, it will act as a logical OR. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

post.description:
Search contacts by a filter.
Support:

| Provider    | Search By       |
| ----------- | --------------- |
| Hubspot     | Email           |
| Salesforce  | Email           |
| Pipedrive   | (Not Supported) |
| MS Dynamics | (Not Supported) |

Upsert a contact. If the contact does not exist, it will be created. If the contact does exist, it will be updated.
Only supported for Salesforce, Hubspot, and Pipedrive.

key.description: The key to upsert on. Only `email` is supported for all providers.

values.description: The values to upsert on. If more than one value is provided, it will act as a logical OR. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

post.description:
Upsert a lead. If the lead does not exist, it will be created. If the lead does exist, it will be updated.
Only supported for Salesforce.

key.description: The key to upsert on. Only `email` is supported.

values.description: The values to upsert on. If more than one value is provided, it will act as a logical OR. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

post.description:
Search leads by a filter.
Support:

| Provider    | Search By       |
| ----------- | --------------- |
| Hubspot     | Email           |
| Salesforce  | Email           |
| Pipedrive   | (Not Supported) |
| MS Dynamics | (Not Supported) |

get.description:
The common schema User maps to the following 3rd-party provider objects:

| Provider  | Remote object ID  |
| --------- | ----------------- |
| Hubspot   | V3 Owner          |
| Dynamics  | Azure System User |
| Intercom  | Admin             |

post.description:
Create custom object record

Support:

| Provider    | Supported |
| ----------- | --------- |
| Hubspot     | Yes       |
| Salesforce  | Yes       |
| Pipedrive   | No        |
| MS Dynamics | No        |

List custom object records
Note: This endpoint will only work if a Sync is setup with the Supaglue managed destination.

| Salesforce  | Yes       |
| Pipedrive   | No        |

Create an association schema

Support:

| Provider    | Supported |
| ----------- | --------- |
| Hubspot     | Yes       |
| Salesforce  | Yes       |
| Pipedrive   | No        |
| MS Dynamics | No        |

Note: When creating a new association schema for Hubspot, Hubspot will also create a default association schema (with an empty name). Either can be used to create associations.

| ----------- | --------- |

| Salesforce  | Yes       |

| MS Dynamics | No        |

200.description: An array containing the names and labels of Custom Objects

post.description:
Create custom object schema

Support:

| Provider    | Supported | Notes                                                   |
| ----------- | --------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Hubspot     | Yes       | All field types supported except picklist/multipicklist |
| Salesforce  | Yes       | All field types supported except picklist/multipicklist |
| Pipedrive   | No        |                                                         |
| MS Dynamics | No        |                                                         |

post.description:
Creates a custom property in the provider and registers it in Supaglue.

:::note
This endpoint is only supported for Salesforce and Hubspot currently.
:::

get.description:
:::note
This feature is only available in Preview to select customers on our Enterprise plan. [Contact us](mailto:team@supaglue.com) for more information.
:::

patch.description:
:::note
This feature is only available in Preview to select customers on our Enterprise plan. [Contact us](mailto:team@supaglue.com) for more information.
:::

:::note
This endpoint is only supported for Salesforce and Hubspot currently.
:::

post.description:
:::note
This feature is only available in Preview to select customers on our Enterprise plan. [Contact us](mailto:team@supaglue.com) for more information.
:::
Registers a custom property in Supaglue.
This may be useful for custom properties that were already created in the Customer's provider.
E.g. a custom field has some machine ID for a particular customer that you want to map to `my_custom_field`.

get.description:
Get custom object schema details

Support:

| Provider    | Supported |
| ----------- | --------- |
| Hubspot     | Yes       |
| Salesforce  | Yes       |
| Pipedrive   | No        |
| MS Dynamics | No        |

Update custom object schema

Support:

| Salesforce  | Yes       | All field types supported except picklist/multipicklist |
| Pipedrive   | No        |                                                         |
| MS Dynamics | No        |                                                         |

get.description:
Support:

| Provider   | Object                                      | Common Schema support | Notes                                 |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------- | --------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| Hubspot    | `contact`, `account`                        | Yes                   | Raw data response from V3 API         |
| Salesforce | `contact`, `account`, `lead`, `opportunity` | Yes                   | Raw data response from V57.0 REST API |

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: The `Account` Common Object represents a "company" in CRMs.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: The `Contact` Common Object represents a "contact" in CRMs.

tags.name: Leads
tags.description: The `Lead` Common Object represents a "potential customer" in CRMs.

tags.name: Opportunities
tags.description: The `Opportunity` Common Object represents a "deal opportunity" in CRMs.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: The `User` Common Object represents a "user" that can log in to CRMs.

tags.name: Lists
tags.description: The `List` Object represents a collection of CRM records.

tags.name: CustomObjectSchemas
tags.description: A `Custom Object Schema` is an object schema defined by the user.

tags.name: StandardObjectSchemas
tags.description: A `Standard Object Schema` is an object schema of a standard object type supported by the provider.

tags.name: CustomObjects
tags.description: A `Custom Object` is an instance of a `Custom Object Schema`.

tags.name: AssociationSchemas
tags.description: An `Association Schema` is an object describing an association between two entities.

tags.name: Association
tags.description: An `Association` is an instance of a relationship between two entities.

tags.name: Properties
tags.description: A `Property` is a field in a Provider Object.

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: API key to allow developers to access the API

description.example: Wants to use open source unified API for third-party integrations

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider.

custom_name.description: Only applicable for custom properties. This represents the unique identifier that can be used to refer to this property across all customers.

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

is_required.description: Whether or not this field is required. Must be false for Salesforce boolean fields.

default_value.description: The default value for the property. Only supported for Salesforce.

group_name.description: Only applicable for Hubspot. If specified, Supaglue will attempt to attach the field to this group if it exists, or create it if it doesn't.

precision.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 18.

scale.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 0.

options.description: The list of options for a picklist/multipicklist field.

raw_details.description: The raw details of the property as provided by the third-party Provider, if available.

name.description: The unique identifier to be used to refer to this property across all customers. Supaglue will use this to appropriately map to the provider field ID.

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

group_name.description: Only applicable for Hubspot. If specified, Supaglue will attempt to attach the field to this group if it exists, or create it if it doesn't. If not specified, Supaglue will create the field in the 'custom_properties' group.

precision.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 18.

scale.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 0.

options.description: The list of options for a picklist/multipicklist field.

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider.

name.description: The unique identifier to be used to refer to this property across all customers. Supaglue will use this to appropriately map to the provider field ID.

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

group_name.description: Only applicable for Hubspot. If specified, Supaglue will attempt to attach the field to this group if it exists, or create it if it doesn't.

precision.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 18.

scale.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 0.

options.description: The list of options for a picklist/multipicklist field.

property_type.description:
Type of the field. :::note `picklist` and `multipicklist` property types are currently only supported in Salesforce and Hubspot ::: :::note `url` property type currently is only natively supported in Salesforce. ::: Support:
Type Hubspot (type-fieldType) Salesforce Pipedrive
text string-text Text varchar_auto
textarea string-textarea Textarea text
number number-number Int/Double (depending on scale) double
picklist enumeration-select Picklist enum
multipicklist enumeration-checkbox Multipicklist set
date date-date Date date
datetime datetime-date Datetime date
boolean bool-booleancheckbox Checkbox enum
url Not Supported Url Not Supported

id.description: The provider-specific unique identifier for this list.

name.description: The developer name of this list.

raw_data.description: The raw data from the provider for this list.

description.example: Wants to use open source unified API for third-party integrations

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider. In Salesforce, this must end with `__c`.

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

is_required.description: Whether or not this field is required. Must be false for Salesforce boolean fields.

default_value.description: The default value for the property. Only supported for Salesforce.

group_name.description: Only applicable for Hubspot. If specified, Supaglue will attempt to attach the field to this group if it exists, or create it if it doesn't.

precision.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 18.

scale.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 0.

options.description: The list of options for a picklist/multipicklist field.

raw_details.description: The raw details of the property as provided by the third-party Provider, if available.

data.Name: Acme Corp
data.Description: We create the best embedded integration platforms.

data.Name: Acme Corp
data.Description: We create the best embedded integration platforms.

association.description: An instance of an association between two records.

source_object.description: The name of the object that the source record belongs to.

target_object.description: The name of the object that the target record belongs to.

id.description: A unique identifier for the instance of the error. Provide this to support when contacting Supaglue.

detail.description: A detailed description of the error.
detail.example: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

problem_type.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

title.description: A brief description of the error. The schema and type of message will vary by Provider.

code.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

cause.description: The cause of the error. Usually the underlying error from the remote Provider.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

application_name.description: The name of the application that generated the error.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

example.detail: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]
example.title: Property values were not valid

custom_fields.description: Custom properties to be inserted that are not covered by the common object. Object keys must match exactly to the corresponding provider API.

suggested_key_name.description: The underlying provider may change this (e.g. adding `__c` for Salesforce).

source_object.description: The name of the object that the source record belongs to.

target_object.description: The name of the object that the target record belongs to.

name.description: The name you'd like to use for the custom object. For Salesforce, we will append `__c` if necessary. For HubSpot, it will pass through as-is.

primary_field_id.description: The key name of the "primary" field. For example, in HubSpot, this is the field that will be displayed for a record in the UI by default. For Salesforce, this will be referenced as the "Name" field.
The key name of the "primary" field. For example, in HubSpot, this is the field that will be displayed for a record in the UI by default. For Salesforce, this will be referenced as the "Name" field.

include_deleted_data.name: include_deleted_data
include_deleted_data.description: Whether to include data that was deleted in providers.

include_raw_data.name: include_raw_data
include_raw_data.description: Whether to include raw data fetched from the 3rd party provider.

read_from_cache.name: read_from_cache
read_from_cache.description:
Whether to read from Supaglue's Managed Destination cache or to read directly from the provider. 


**NOTE**: `read_from_cache=true` requires you to have the object synced to the Supaglue Managed Destination.

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

created_before.name: created_before
created_before.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

modified_after.name: modified_after
modified_after.description: If provided, will only return objects modified after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

modified_before.name: modified_before
modified_before.description: If provided, will only return objects modified before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

remote_provider_page_size.name: page_size
remote_provider_page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. (Max: 100)

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. (Max: 1000)

x-customer-id.name: x-customer-id
x-customer-id.description: The customer ID that uniquely identifies the customer in your application

object_type.name: object_type
object_type.description:
The Supaglue common object type to fetch a list for. Support:
Provider Object Type
Salesforce countact, account, opportunity, lead
Hubspot contact, account

object_name.name: object_name
object_name.description: The unique name of the custom object. For Salesforce, this should end with __c. For Hubspot, this will typically be the singular form of the object.

associations_to_fetch.name: associations_to_fetch
associations_to_fetch.description: List of associated objects to attempt to fetch associations for. Only relevant for hubspot and when `read_from_cache` is false.
